In addition, sometimes animals from hot countries have to survive in the cold winter of somewhere in Europe.On the other hand, the advocators believe that zoos provide the public with good entertainment and also help to ensure the balance of the ecology. Many people, especially young children enjoy going to zoos and see their favorite animals, cute baby-born animals and the animals that are from the different corners of the world. Zoos provide educational information about the lives of different animals to the public. Also, zoos play an important role in reserving many breeds of animal and preventing them from being missing from life. This is due to the fact that, in zoos, animals are kept in enclosures which simulate their own habitats and also endangered animals are being protected from their predators or hunters. Thus zoos are needed to keep the nature balanced.In conclusion, both of the arguments have strong supports, but in my own view, more good come from zoos than bad. However, it is hoped that the standards of zoos should be leveled up to ensure that the animals in zoos are provided with good care and attention.
llm: I agree with the statement that animals should be free and people should not keep them in zoos. Keeping animals in zoos is a form of captivity that can be detrimental to their physical and mental well-being. One of the primary reasons is that zoos cannot provide the same natural habitat and space that animals would have in the wild. For instance, elephants in zoos often exhibit abnormal behaviors such as pacing and swaying due to the lack of space and stimulation.Another reason is that zoos often prioritize human entertainment over animal welfare. Many zoos keep animals in small enclosures for the sole purpose of entertaining visitors, which can be stressful and traumatic for the animals. For example, the practice of keeping orcas in seawater parks has been widely criticized due to the cramped and unnatural conditions that these intelligent and social animals are forced to endure.Additionally, keeping animals in zoos can also disrupt their natural social structures and behaviors. In the wild, many animals live in complex societies with their own social hierarchies and behaviors. In zoos, these social structures are often disrupted, leading to abnormal behaviors and stress. For example, the removal of a dominant animal from a group can lead to fighting and instability among the remaining animals.In conclusion, I firmly believe that animals should be free and not kept in zoos. The harm caused by captivity, lack of natural habitat, and disruption of social structures outweigh any potential benefits of keeping animals in zoos. Instead, we should focus on conservation efforts that protect and preserve animals in their natural habitats, allowing them to thrive and live as they were meant to.

question: Creative artists should always be given the freedom to express their own ideas (in words, picture, music or film) in whichever way they wish. There should be no government restrictions on what they do. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this?
human: Artists in most countries are given the freedom to express their thoughts in whatever they do. Nevertheless, some argue that there should be government restrictions in order to limit their opinions. I however, agree to this only to a certain extent and believe that the artists must be given freedom so that they will produce some really marvelous masterpiece.First and foremost, if there is control over artists' ideas, they will definitely lose their sense of creativity in the long run. It is undeniable that when they are given the opportunity to express themselves, most artists will think out of the box and come up with spectacular Arts such as paintings or movies. For example, paintings by Da Vinci and Michallengo are admired even till now as they were not restricted during those times. In short, without any limitations, there will be more awe inspiring work from our artists.Furthermore, it is every human's right to be able to voice out their opinions in any ways as long as they do not cause any problems to the nation. Today, many countries make numerous efforts to show that they are democratic countries. Arts is one of the ways that can be used to criticise social problems and government policies in a particular country. To illustrate this further, the famous movie '3 Idiots' acted by Amir Khan criticises the education system which is chiefly based on memorising and not being able to apply whatever the students learn. Thus, human rights is violated if artists are not allowed to express their feelings freely.Looking from another perspective, there are certain drawbacks if artists are not restricted. They might go deeper into certain aspects that can cause controversies in a country. To cite an example, Malaysia is a multiracial country whereby all the citizens live together in harmony and peace. In case there is anyone who brings up some sensitive issues in their films or books regarding any races, this might end up in some chaos among the society. Nonetheless, I believe that artists know their boundaries very well and would surely do not want their names tarnished just because of their unscrupulous acts.To conclude, it is now evident that there should not be any restrictions on artists' work. Allowing them to think freely will give them an opportunity to express themselves as ideas can naturally flow when there are no limitations. Hence, even though freedom to express ideas can bring some negative effects, I certainly believe that there are many wonderful and beautiful Arts due to the freedom to express ideas and thus, I strongly believe there should be no restrictions on them.
llm: The notion that creative artists should have absolute freedom to express their ideas without any government restrictions is a contentious issue. While I agree that artistic expression is essential for a vibrant and diverse culture, I also believe that some limitations are necessary to prevent harm and ensure social responsibility.On the one hand, artistic freedom allows for the creation of innovative and thought-provoking works that challenge societal norms and inspire critical thinking. Unfettered expression enables artists to push boundaries, explore new ideas, and give voice to marginalized communities. This freedom is essential for the development of art, literature, music, and film, as it fosters creativity, experimentation, and progress.On the other hand, completely unregulated artistic expression can lead to the dissemination of hate speech, obscenity, and harmful content that can cause offense, promote violence, or perpetuate discriminatory attitudes. In such cases, government restrictions can serve as a necessary check to protect vulnerable individuals and maintain social cohesion. For instance, laws against child pornography, hate speech, or incitement to violence are essential to prevent harm and ensure public safety.In conclusion, while I believe that artistic freedom is crucial for creative expression and cultural development, I also think that some government restrictions are necessary to prevent harm and ensure social responsibility. A balanced approach that protects artistic freedom while preventing harm to others is the most appropriate way forward. This can be achieved through laws and regulations that are carefully crafted to promote artistic expression while safeguarding the well-being of society. Ultimately, the key is to strike a balance between artistic freedom and social responsibility, allowing creative artists to express themselves while minimizing harm to others.

question: Advertising is all around us, it is an unavoidable part of everyone's life. Some people say that advertising is a positive part of our lives while others say it is negative. Discuss both views and give your own opinion. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.Ê
human: Nowadays, the use of advertisement through different forms of media such as newspapers, radio and television has become very prevalent, so it is thought to be a necessary part of today's society. Many believe that advertising has brought great benefits to lives therefore it should be considered a positive activity while others have held a complete different idea about this. Both views will be critiqued before a reasonable conclusion is drawn.First, it is generally understood that advertising is carried out with the main purpose of promoting different products and services or encouraging people to consume more. Advertisements are, therefore, very important for many businesses to increase sales and hence profits. Also, to consumers, advertising can bring them many benefits. For example, customers of telecommunication services will have an idea about the current offers of different companies and hence they can compare them and then have a better decision in choosing their internet or mobile phone plans. From all of these, it is easy to see why the idea that advertising is a positive part of life will garner strong support.However, it can be seen that some people have argued against advertising due to its negative impacts. Firstly, a huge amount of different advertisements could be sent automatically by a system to personal phones or email addresses, this is generally known as spam, and causes discomfort or even annoyance to many people. Secondly, advertising can be very expensive and not every advertising campaign can be done successfully and brings good results. Therefore, advertising is believed by many, a financial burden to businesses.In conclusion, after analyzing the pros and cons of advertising, both of the views have strong support, but it is felt that more good comes from advertising than bad. Thus, the idea that advertising is a positive part of life can be more supported.
llm: The omnipresence of advertising in our daily lives has sparked a heated debate about its impact on society. While some argue that advertising has a positive influence, others claim it has a negative effect. In this essay, I will discuss both views and provide my own opinion.On the one hand, some people believe that advertising is a positive part of our lives. It informs us about new products, services, and ideas, which can improve our lives and provide us with more choices. For instance, advertisements for life-saving medicines or health awareness campaigns can educate people about diseases and their treatments. Additionally, advertising can also promote cultural and social values, such as equality and environmental protection. Many companies use their advertisements to raise awareness about social issues, which can lead to positive changes in society.On the other hand, others argue that advertising has a negative impact. It can be misleading and manipulative, influencing people to buy unnecessary products or services. For example, advertisements for junk food or sugary drinks can contribute to the growing obesity epidemic, especially among children. Furthermore, excessive advertising can also lead to consumerism and materialism, promoting a culture of overconsumption and waste.In my opinion, advertising can be both positive and negative, depending on how it is used. While it can provide valuable information and promote social values, it can also be misleading and promote overconsumption. Therefore, it is essential to regulate advertising and ensure that it is honest and responsible. By doing so, we can minimize its negative effects and maximize its positive impact. Ultimately, advertising is a powerful tool that can be used to shape our attitudes and behaviors, and it is up to us to use it wisely.

question: The nuclear power provide clean and cheap energy.ÊThe advantages of nuclear technology outweigh the disadvantages. Do you agree or disagree ?
human: The topic of nuclear technology frequently generates a heated debate with proponents maintaining that nuclear power provides a source of efficient and economical energy while opponents argue that atomic technology is uncontrollable and very dangerous to handle. As far as my opinion is concerned, I find myself aligned with opponents of the usages of nuclear power. I have several reasons to believe its disadvantages outnumber the few advantages.First and foremost reason is that pursuit of nuclear technology one way or the other leads towards atomic weapons. Last century has witnessed the horrors of such weapons. If each country pursues the fusion and fission process some of them may try to mold it for military usage.Another reason to fortify my opinion is that even civil usages of atomic power pose a dire threat of radio activity. For example recently there has been an incident in which an atomic power house leaked tons of radio active material into air when an earthquake hit the surrounding area. This unfortunate event proves that no matter how much careful we are such accidents are inevitable.Last but not least, while generating energy from any source be it hydro power or oil there always is some wastage and so is the case with nuclear power. Safely getting rid of nuclear waste is a daunting task and there has not been any permanent solution of it. This waste is many times more lethal to our environment than any of the other hazardous material.To sum it up, from above mentioned facts it can easily be deduced that nuclear power may appear silver bullet for energy crisis but its disadvantages far outweigh the advantages. Thus I suggest that use of nuclear technology should be discouraged even for civil purposes.
llm: The statement that nuclear power provides clean and cheap energy and that its advantages outweigh the disadvantages is a topic of ongoing debate. On one hand, nuclear power is indeed a clean source of energy as it does not produce greenhouse gases or other harmful emissions during operation, making it an attractive alternative to fossil fuels in the fight against climate change. Additionally, nuclear energy is a reliable and constant source of power, unlike solar or wind energy which are intermittent.On the other hand, the disadvantages of nuclear power cannot be overlooked. One of the major drawbacks is the production of radioactive waste, which remains hazardous for thousands of years and poses significant challenges for storage and disposal. Furthermore, nuclear accidents, such as those at Chernobyl and Fukushima, have highlighted the catastrophic risks associated with nuclear power generation. These incidents not only cause immediate harm to human health and the environment but also have long-term consequences.Moreover, while the cost of generating electricity from nuclear power can be relatively low once a plant is operational, the initial construction costs are extremely high, and the cost of decommissioning at the end of a plant's life must also be factored into the overall expense. In conclusion, although nuclear power has its advantages, including providing a clean and reliable source of energy, the disadvantages, particularly the risks associated with nuclear waste and accidents, cannot be ignored. Therefore, I disagree that the advantages of nuclear technology outweigh the disadvantages. A more balanced approach, considering all forms of energy production and their respective benefits and drawbacks, is necessary for a sustainable energy future.

question: Some people argue that the government should give every unemployed person a mobile phone and should make sure they have access to the Internet. They believe this is the best way of using the public money to reduce the problem of unemployment. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Ê
human: Today, the rate of unemployment is on the rise and is seriously being debated by many. Some opine that the best method to minimize this problem is by providing the unemployed with hand phones that have access to the Internet. They also believe that this solution is the most appropriate way to utilize the public money. Nevertheless, I agree to this solution only to a certain degree because I feel that giving those with no work a mobile phone each is a total waste of money.In a positive point of view, when people without jobs have hand phones that have access to the Internet, they will be able to browse the net for more job opportunities. For example, they can surf the The Star Onlines' work section to find a job that is suitable for them. With the help of the net, they can also do more research on the work that they have found apart from looking up on how they can prepare themselves for the job. Not only that, the mobile phones can also be used to make calls with the companies in which they would like to work with. In short, if the government provides those without work with a mobile phone, they will be able to find themselves an occupation in order to live and survive.Nonetheless, looking from another perspective, supplying hand phones to the unemployed is a waste of the taxpayers' money. This is because the money instead of being used to supply the electronic gadget can be used for other useful purposes for the country. To illustrate this further, the money can be used to build more amenities for the public or given to the poor so that they can use it to help them earn a living. To conclude, the money can be used for other intentions rather than giving hand phones to the unemployed.Furthermore, when hand phones are provided for free, many would want to take advantage of this opportunity. It will not be surprising that in order to obtain a mobile phone, they make themselves jobless. Some might even go to the extent of lying that they are on unemployment to make them eligible to get the phones. In this context, the public's money is spent worthlessly. On top of that, till now, there are no surveys or evidences that prove this method in effective in reducing the rate of unemployment.To put it in a nutshell, the suggestion of providing those who are jobless with mobile phones that are accessible to internet is not a proper and the best way to trim down the rate of unemployment. I suggest the government look into the background of the people in depth before giving out hand phones to them. I strongly believe that the public money should be utilized for the benefit of the society and not just for some of them who are not willing to put in more effort to find them a proper work.
llm: The notion that the government should provide every unemployed person with a mobile phone and ensure access to the Internet has sparked a heated debate. While some argue that this is an effective way to utilize public funds to alleviate unemployment, I only partially agree with this stance.On the one hand, providing mobile phones and Internet access can be beneficial for job seekers. It enables them to stay connected with potential employers, receive job alerts, and access online job portals. Moreover, the Internet offers a wealth of information on job training, resume building, and career development, which can be invaluable for those seeking employment. By bridging the digital divide, the government can empower unemployed individuals to actively pursue job opportunities and enhance their employability.On the other hand, I disagree that providing mobile phones and Internet access is the most effective use of public money to reduce unemployment. Other initiatives such as vocational training programs, education, and job creation schemes may have a more direct and significant impact on reducing unemployment rates. Furthermore, the cost of implementing and maintaining such a program could be substantial, and it may not be feasible for governments with limited budgets.In conclusion, while I acknowledge the potential benefits of providing mobile phones and Internet access to unemployed individuals, I believe that this measure should be part of a broader strategy to address unemployment. The government should prioritize initiatives that directly create jobs, enhance skills, and foster economic growth, and then supplement these efforts with programs that promote digital inclusion. By adopting a multi-faceted approach, the government can more effectively utilize public funds to combat unemployment.

question: The use of close circuit television (CCTV) cameras in streets, stations, shops and other public places has increased rapidly in recent years. Although we are told that these cameras help in the fight against crime, some people are opposed to their use. They believe that everyone has a right to privacy. What are your views?
human: Today, close circuit television (CCTV) cameras are widely used in a variety of circumstances. They are used in schools, businesses and some other premises in order to monitor the activities taking place. It is undeniable that the use of CCTV has plenty of benefits to offer, especially in reducing crimes and protecting the employees in a premise. Nevertheless, some argue that these cameras invade their privacies due to constantly being monitored. Even so, I strongly believe that CCTV cameras should be installed in every premise to combat the ever increasing theft rate and to protect the workers at the workplace.Firstly, by having CCTV cameras at workplace, crimes such as robbery can be trimmed down. This is because when a shop is attacked by thieves, the clips taken by these cameras serve as a source of evidence to help the thieves to be traced. To illustrate this further, in Malaysia, policemen used the videos captured by the CCTV cameras to trace and successfully catch a group of robbers who broke into a Seven Eleven shop during the midnight. Not only that, as the employees know that they are under constant surveillance, they will less likely steal from the shops. Thus, it is clear that CCTVs must be put in all workplace so that crime rates can be minimized.Furthermore, at some offices, employees are often required to handle angry or frustrated customers. At times, face-to-face interactions with an annoyed customer can put the employee in physical danger. Hence, the installation of CCTV cameras may help the employees escape this situation because the customers know very well that their conversations are recorded. In the event of an argument, the videotapes can used to determine what actually took place and further actions can be then taken. In short, these cameras can help to provide some form of protection to the workers against the customers.Looking from another perspective, the use of CCTV cameras does cause controversy. Those opposing the CCTV systems feel that their privacies are invaded with the constant monitoring of the cameras. However, one must realize that safety is of paramount importance compared to privacy and prevention is always better than suffering from the consequences. Ergo, opponents of this system should try to comprehend the situation and take actions to prevent themselves from being victims of crime.To conclude, CCTV cameras are essential and therefore must be installed in every premise. This is chiefly to shield oneself from being harmed by any intruders or robbers. Admittedly, privacies are lost with the use of these cameras. Nonetheless, safety should be put first in order to be safe.
llm: The widespread installation of close circuit television (CCTV) cameras in public areas has sparked a heated debate about their impact on society. On one hand, proponents argue that CCTV cameras are an effective tool in the fight against crime, as they can deter potential offenders and aid in the identification and prosecution of criminals. The presence of these cameras can make the public feel safer, particularly in high-crime areas or at night. Furthermore, CCTV footage can serve as valuable evidence in investigations, helping to solve crimes and bring perpetrators to justice.On the other hand, opponents of CCTV cameras argue that they infringe upon individuals' right to privacy. They believe that the constant surveillance is an invasion of personal space and can lead to a sense of mistrust among the public. Moreover, there are concerns about who has access to the footage and how it is used, raising questions about potential misuse or abuse. Some also argue that the funds spent on installing and maintaining CCTV cameras could be better allocated to other crime prevention strategies, such as community policing or social programs aimed at addressing the root causes of crime.In my view, while the right to privacy is fundamental, the benefits of CCTV cameras in enhancing public safety and reducing crime outweigh the concerns about privacy. However, it is crucial that strict guidelines and regulations are in place to ensure that CCTV cameras are used responsibly and that the footage is handled and stored securely to prevent misuse. Transparency about the locations and purposes of CCTV cameras, as well as regular audits to ensure their effective and ethical use, can also help to alleviate privacy concerns. Ultimately, a balanced approach that considers both public safety and individual rights is necessary to make the most out of CCTV technology.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city? Do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays living is possible on every place of the world, but still there are some differences among them. From my point of view big cities can be a good place for bringing up children.To begin with, it is undeniable that education is better in big cities in comparison with countrysides. For instance, in my country the best schools, universities and institutes are located in cities, and todays education is one of the most important parts of our children's life. Therefore, it is a good idea for children to past their first earlier life in the cities.What is more, it is acknowledged that a large number of creational facilities are built in cities. Children who live in cities have a lot of entertainment. For example playgrounds, parks, science museums, cinemas etc. However, in countrysides we hardly ever see creational facilities. Children who live in countrysides most of the time pass their free time in farms.Finally, in big cities children access to media easily, so they can learn a lot of things by watching television and surfing through the net. Via internet they can have connection with the other children all around the world, therefor they can exchange their knowledge, they can learn different cultures.To sum up, although countrysides have some advantages such as fresh air, peace, and etc. Today's children needs somethings to entertain them, and occupy their leisure time in the best way.
llm: The debate about whether it is better for children to grow up in the countryside or in a big city has been ongoing for years. While some argue that the city provides more opportunities and exposure, I firmly believe that growing up in the countryside is more beneficial for children.One of the primary advantages of growing up in the countryside is the cleaner and healthier environment. The air and water are fresher, and the pace of life is slower, which can lead to a more relaxed and peaceful childhood. In contrast, cities are often plagued by pollution, noise, and crowds, which can be overwhelming and stressful for young children. Additionally, the countryside provides ample space for children to play and explore, allowing them to develop a stronger connection with nature and engage in physical activities.Another significant benefit of growing up in the countryside is the stronger sense of community. Rural areas often have a closer-knit community where neighbors know and look out for each other, providing a safer and more supportive environment for children to grow and thrive. Furthermore, the countryside offers a more simplistic and traditional way of life, which can help children develop important life skills such as self-sufficiency and resourcefulness.In conclusion, while cities may offer more amenities and opportunities, I believe that growing up in the countryside is better for children. The cleaner environment, stronger sense of community, and more relaxed pace of life all contribute to a healthier and happier childhood. As such, I strongly agree that the countryside is a more suitable place for children to grow and develop into capable and well-rounded individuals.

question: Some people prefer to take a position in a company and work for the company. Other people think is better to go into business for themselves. Which do you think is better?
human: There are many kinds of jobs in society. Some of them are done by companies that related to government, and some of them are done by privat companies. Although both companies have their advantages and disadvantages, I would prefer to work for myself, and have my own business. There are many benefits when people work for themselves rather than work for the others. In the first place, there are a large number of opportunities in privat works that you cannot find them when you work for the others. In your job you can be boss of yourself; however, in the other jobs someone else are your boss. You always have to be responsible for your task, and it make a stressful situation that I never like it.What is more, when people work for themselves they make more profit for themselves, but in the other jobs you make profits for the other such as your manager. Unfortunately nowadays most of them pick up this profit without sharing a small sum of it with their workers, and from my point of view it is unfair.Finally, there are some authorities in privat jobs that workers are always looking for them while they are working for the others. When you work for yourself you can punch in and punch out whenever you want. Sometimes some occasions happen to people for example a disease, sticking in a traffic jam and sometime going on a vacation. For all of them we have to ask for a permission, and most of the time we are not allowed.There is no doubt that working for the other have some advantages, too, but I imagine people that have their own business are more comfortable. They have more opportunities, profits, and authorities.
llm: The age-old debate about whether to work for a company or to venture into business for oneself has sparked intense discussion. While some individuals prefer the stability and security that comes with being employed by a company, others believe that being their own boss is the key to success and happiness. In my opinion, going into business for oneself is the better option.On one hand, working for a company provides a sense of security and stability. Employees receive a regular paycheck, benefits, and a clear career path. However, this stability often comes at the cost of creativity, autonomy, and potential for growth. Employees are often limited in their ability to make decisions and take risks, which can stifle innovation and progress.On the other hand, going into business for oneself offers unparalleled freedom and flexibility. Entrepreneurs have the ability to pursue their passions, make their own decisions, and reap the rewards of their hard work. While the road to success may be paved with uncertainty and risk, the potential for growth and return on investment is exponentially higher. Moreover, entrepreneurs have the opportunity to create jobs, contribute to their community, and leave a lasting legacy.Furthermore, being one's own boss allows for a better work-life balance and greater job satisfaction. Without the constraints of a 9-to-5 job, entrepreneurs can create a schedule that suits their needs and priorities. Additionally, the sense of accomplishment and pride that comes with building a successful business is unmatched.In conclusion, while working for a company has its benefits, I firmly believe that going into business for oneself is the better option. The freedom, flexibility, and potential for growth that comes with entrepreneurship far outweigh the stability and security of being employed. With great risk comes great reward, and for those willing to take the leap, the rewards can be limitless.

question: The expression "Never,never give up" means keep trying and never stop working for your goal. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Many individuals throughout their life face with at least one failure in different areas such as education, love and economy. Some believe when a person faces with a failure the best way is to forget that and releases that; however, I completely disagree with this idea. I always believe that a defeated person has to try and try until to achieve her or his goal. First of all, when people face with a failure they can learn a large number of things from that failure, therefore in the next effort they try to avoid doing and repeating that mistakes. For instance, most of inventors in the first phases of their job face with some problems and defeats, but in the next stages they learn how to deal with problems.Second of all, experience shows while people doing a job constantly, they become more experienced in that subject, so in the final effort they become successful with the high percentile. For example, scientists experiment a substance for a long time, after they gain lots of experience and knowledge about that subject they decide to make it final.To sum up, I would maintain that people should not give up when they face with a failure. In opposite, they have to learn new points from that failure, and they become more experienced.
llm: The expression "Never, never give up" is a motivational mantra that has been echoed by numerous successful individuals throughout history. It emphasizes the importance of perseverance and persistence in achieving one's goals. I strongly agree with this statement, as giving up can lead to missed opportunities and unfulfilled potential.When faced with obstacles and setbacks, it is easy to feel discouraged and consider giving up. However, the reality is that every successful person has experienced failures and setbacks at some point in their journey. Thomas Edison, for instance, is famously known for saying "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." His persistence and refusal to give up ultimately led to the invention of the light bulb.Giving up can also lead to a sense of regret and "what ifs." Imagine if J.K. Rowling had given up on her Harry Potter manuscript after being rejected by numerous publishers. The world would have been deprived of a beloved book series that has inspired millions of readers. By persisting and continuing to work towards their goals, individuals can overcome even the most daunting challenges and achieve greatness.In conclusion, the expression "Never, never give up" is a powerful reminder that success often requires perseverance and determination. By adopting this mindset, individuals can overcome obstacles, achieve their goals, and reach their full potential. As the famous poet Maya Angelou once said, "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." Therefore, I firmly believe that never giving up is essential to achieving success and living a fulfilling life.

question: Some people think that human needs for farmland, housing and industry are more important than saving land for endangered animals. Do you agree or disagree with this point of view?
human: Nowadays there are some issues which many countries and nations are concern about that. Two of the most important of them are rate of increasing population and endangered plants and animals. From my point of view although endangered animals are important, human needs should be considered more.Firstly, day by day population is increasing, so human needs for food is increasing as well. We need farmland to grow crops such as wheat and corn, and there is no doubt that without food people cannot alive for more than some weeks. Therefore, farmlands are vital for human life.Secondly, people need shelters to protect themselves from mother nature such as wind and flood and wild animals, so they need land to build their houses on it. Dwelling is one of the most important human needs after food which is undeniable.Finally, human need some crucial things to continue their life, and most of them are industrial such as medicine. Therefore, some lands should be assigned to industry. Todays life has some difficulty which become comfortable with the help of industry. To conclude, the population of endangered animals are less than people's population, so they do not need so much land that people need. I would maintain that nowadays humans need farmland, housing and industry because of increasing population are more important than saving land for endangered animals.
llm: The debate surrounding the preservation of land for endangered animals versus human needs for farmland, housing, and industry has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that human necessities take precedence over conservation efforts, I firmly disagree with this viewpoint.On one hand, the demands for farmland, housing, and industry are undoubtedly crucial for human survival and economic growth. However, prioritizing these needs over the preservation of endangered species can have severe and irreversible consequences. The loss of biodiversity can disrupt delicate ecosystems, leading to catastrophic effects on the environment, climate, and ultimately, human well-being.On the other hand, preserving land for endangered animals is not only a moral obligation, but also essential for maintaining ecological balance. These species play a vital role in maintaining the health of ecosystems, and their loss can have far-reaching and devastating consequences. Furthermore, many endangered species have the potential to provide groundbreaking medical and scientific discoveries, which could greatly benefit humanity.Rather than pitting human needs against conservation, I believe that a balanced approach can be adopted. Sustainable development and innovative technologies can help minimize the impact of human activities on the environment, allowing for the coexistence of farmland, housing, and industry with protected areas for endangered species. Governments, organizations, and individuals must work together to establish and maintain nature reserves, implement conservation policies, and promote eco-friendly practices.In conclusion, while human needs are essential, I strongly disagree that they should take precedence over saving land for endangered animals. The preservation of biodiversity is not only a moral duty, but also crucial for the long-term sustainability of our planet. By adopting a balanced and sustainable approach, we can ensure the well-being of both humans and the natural world.

question: One should never judge a person by external appearance. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Individuals have two features, one of them is appearance and the other one is personality. From my point of view although appearance is important, personality is the most important. We can never judge about a person with his or her appearance. Some people believes, individuals who have black skin or are frown are not good person and in opposite individuals who have pale or white skin or always have smile on their face are good person. I completely disagree with these kind of judgement which someone makes.First of all, there are people who play a role and cheat the other individuals with their playing, therefore we have to be aware to never judge with their appearance. For example, some people cheat their fiance before marriage by showing a cheerful face and well spoken; however, after getting marriage they show their real personality.Second of all, there are some people who are black skin, fat and frown, nonetheless they might be a great person for leaving and colleague. For instance, I have a neighbor who are old, black skin and frown and I had always panicked of her. One day in a cold winter while I was getting back to home from school I realized that I lost my keys, so I could not do anything before my parents getting back home. She asked me to stay with her till my parents come, also she was great in hospitality and her behavior was unforgettable. After that I understood, I had to never judge with people's appearance.All in all, the best way to judge about individuals' is to be familiar with their personality not with their appearance. Unfortunately, many people play role to cheat the others, and they try to hide their real personality with their appearance.
llm: The age-old adage "never judge a person by external appearance" is a timeless wisdom that still holds relevance today. I wholeheartedly agree with this statement, as it emphasizes the importance of looking beyond a person's physical appearance to truly understand their character, abilities, and worth.Judging someone based on their external appearance can lead to misconceptions and misunderstandings. A person's physical attributes, such as their height, weight, or facial features, do not necessarily reflect their intelligence, kindness, or talents. Moreover, people from different cultural backgrounds may have distinct physical characteristics that should not be misinterpreted as inferior or superior.History is replete with examples of individuals who were underestimated or misunderstood due to their appearance, only to prove others wrong. For instance, Albert Einstein, one of the most brilliant minds in history, was known for his disheveled hair and worn-out clothes. If people had judged him based on his appearance, they would have missed out on the opportunity to learn from his groundbreaking theories.Furthermore, judging people based on their appearance can lead to discrimination, prejudice, and social exclusion. It is essential to recognize that every individual has a unique story, experiences, and perspectives that cannot be captured by their physical appearance. By looking beyond the surface level, we can foster a more inclusive, empathetic, and compassionate society.In conclusion, it is crucial to remember that a person's worth and character cannot be measured by their external appearance. We should strive to get to know individuals as they truly are, beyond their physical attributes. By doing so, we can break down social barriers, build meaningful relationships, and create a more harmonious and accepting community. Ultimately, never judging a person by external appearance is a vital principle that can help us appreciate the diversity and richness of human experience.

question: Some people believe that there should be a single international language. Others believe that this would make it difficult to maintain the identity of cultures. What's your opinion?
human: The 21st century has witnessed the sweeping trends of globalization, which raises people's concerns about whether a single international language should be a necessity or not. From my perspective, a universal language playing the dominant role in the international community is of vital significance to global people.It is especially true if we consider the fact that a single international language plays a pivotal role in global economic cooperation. As businessmen from different countries have access to the same language, they can communicate with each other more efficiently and deeply on trade, which can intensify the transnational cooperation. In contrast, without the availability of the same language, there might be a chance that misunderstanding and conflicts would ensue over business negotiations, impeding collaborations between them. Therefore, a single international language serves an economic purpose.Also, a universal language is an integral part of cultural communication and interactions. If people are equipped with a single international language, they can tell each other smoothly about their countries' specific cultures such as the traditional customs or the modern lifestyles, which enables people to expand their outlooks, viewing the world in new angles. For example, when people travel to foreign countries, the local people can introduce the tourist attractions to such people with the command of the universal language, helping foreign visitors have an enjoyable exotic experience.In spite of this, the disadvantages of the promotion of a universal language cannot be denied. To be more specific, a single international language may, to some extent, erode the cultural identity of a nation. This is because people may be impressed by the cultural values brought with the universal language, eroding a sense of national belong. For instance, some Asians are seeking individualism, previously denied by many Asian countries, due to the fact that they have gradually identified with such values expressed in American movies, which are imported by the governments as a result of the proliferation of English.Therefore, I would conclude that a single international language contributes to global community in terms of economic and cultural communication. On the other hand, every country should by no means disregard the preservation of their own cultural heritage.
llm: The debate about whether there should be a single international language has sparked intense discussion among linguists, cultural enthusiasts, and globalization proponents. While some argue that a universal language would facilitate global communication and unity, others contend that it would lead to cultural homogenization and loss of identity. In my opinion, having a single international language would undermine the rich cultural diversity that exists across the globe.On one hand, a universal language would undoubtedly simplify international interactions, as people from different countries could communicate effortlessly. This would be particularly beneficial in fields like business, science, and diplomacy, where clear communication is crucial. Moreover, it would facilitate the exchange of ideas, knowledge, and cultures, thereby promoting global understanding and cooperation.On the other hand, the adoption of a single international language would pose a significant threat to the preservation of cultural identities. Language is an integral part of a culture's heritage, and its loss would inevitably lead to the erosion of traditions, customs, and values. The unique linguistic characteristics, idioms, and expressions that make a culture distinct would be lost, as people would increasingly rely on the universal language. This would result in a monotonous cultural landscape, where the diversity and complexity that make human experience so rich and fascinating would be reduced to a bland, uniform entity.In conclusion, while a single international language may have its advantages, I firmly believe that the preservation of cultural identities and linguistic diversity is essential. Instead of imposing a universal language, we should strive to promote language learning and cultural exchange, allowing people to appreciate and respect the diversity of languages and cultures that exist worldwide. By doing so, we can foster global understanding and cooperation while preserving the rich tapestry of human cultures.

question: Fashion trends are difficult to follow these days and it is believed that they primarily just to sell clothes. Some people believe that we should not follow them and that we should dress in what we like. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: With increasing availability to the Internet, people can collect a wealth of information about the latest fashion trends over the world, such as the most popular shoes style this season or the best-liked clothes color this year. However, some people think that dressing in a personal style should be advocated rather than following fashion trends. From my perspective, fashion trends have a more essential role to play in people's lives than personal dressing styles.This is because following fashion trends enables people to keep up with the world's latest transformations, which is of vital importance if we consider the fact that people are living in a global village today. When individuals keep the habit of grasping the world's cutting-edge fashion information, they are gradually changing their attitudes to viewing the world, which means they are more open to accept diverse voices from people around the world. In contrast, if they stuck to their own fashion styles, disregarding the world's top fashion designers' achievements, they would stay conservative in their own worlds. As a result, they might fall behind shortly.Furthermore, people with inadequate aesthetic knowledge or poor originality develop their own senses of fashion when treasuring the latest fashion information. Without following fashion trends, such people would have a hard time choosing and matching clothes, let alone forming their own dressing styles.Despite this, it is undeniable that following fashion trends constantly may undermine individuals' personalities. Individuals purchase their clothes according to the latest fashion trends, which may result in the phenomenon that people would wear the same style of clothes. Consequently, the world would look monotonous.With those arguments in mind, I would conclude that people should, especially for ones lacking basic aesthetic knowledge, care more about fashion trends in lives as they can keep pace with the world's changes. On the other hand, creative design talents can value their own dressing ideas, developing their own fashion styles as they like.
llm: The world of fashion is ever-evolving, with new trends emerging every season. However, it has become increasingly challenging to keep up with these trends, and many believe that they are merely a ploy to sell clothes. In my opinion, I agree that we should not blindly follow fashion trends and instead, dress in what makes us feel confident and comfortable.On one hand, following fashion trends can be seen as a form of self-expression and a way to showcase one's personality. It can also be a fun and exciting way to stay updated with the latest styles and must-haves. Nevertheless, the pressure to constantly keep up with the latest trends can be overwhelming and lead to a sense of superficiality. The emphasis on material possessions and the need to constantly purchase new clothes can also have a negative impact on the environment and our wallets.On the other hand, dressing in what we like allows us to develop our own unique sense of style and express ourselves in a more authentic way. It also promotes sustainability, as we are not constantly feeling the need to purchase new clothes to keep up with the trends. Furthermore, it allows us to focus on what truly matters, such as our comfort, confidence, and individuality. By dressing in what we like, we are also sending a message that we value our own opinions and tastes over the dictates of the fashion industry.In conclusion, while following fashion trends can be a fun and creative outlet, I believe that it is more important to dress in what makes us feel confident and comfortable. By doing so, we promote sustainability, individuality, and a more authentic sense of self-expression. Ultimately, fashion should be a means of self-expression, not a source of stress or pressure to conform.

question: Should wealthy nations be required to share their wealth among poorer nations by providing such things as food and education? Or is it the responsibility of the governments of poorer nations to look after their citizens themselves?
human: Whether wealthy nations should take responsibilities to help poorer ones, by means of providing infrastructures, or remain bystander of the global poverty, is an issue of controversy. Personally I think, as the privileged minority, wealthy nations have every reason to share their fortune with the poor.In terms of ethics, it is inhumane to watch one's fellowman struggle against famine and poverty without doing anything to help, especially when the onlooker takes no effort to do so. Compassion, a virtue preached in almost all religions from Buddhism to Mohammedanism, is what distinguishes us human beings from animals.Economically speaking, such aid could also create a win-win situation. Underdeveloped nations no doubt receive direct benefits through such deeds. For developed nations, new medical problems may very well arise from the work in underdeveloped nations; thus related research is conducted accordingly to conquer the problem, promoting the development of the pharmaceutical industry. The potential market in those poor countries, most of which has a huge population, is also a thing worth mentioning. By building a good relationship with them, wealthy nations can not only broaden their global market, but also facilitate future international commerce. The underdeveloped nations, in return, may export local agricultural products, mineral products with discount to the former, boosting each other's economy.In summary, wealthy nations' offering in need is not only a moral deed, but also a worthwhile one which will one day pay off in other ways. Only those who sympathize with their fellowman can prosper in the long run.
llm: The debate over whether wealthy nations should share their wealth with poorer nations has sparked intense discussion. On one hand, providing food and education to impoverished countries can be seen as a moral obligation, as it can greatly alleviate human suffering and promote global stability. Wealthy nations have a significant surplus of resources, and sharing them with those in need can be a powerful tool in reducing poverty and inequality. Furthermore, providing education can empower individuals and communities, enabling them to break the cycle of poverty and become self-sufficient.On the other hand, some argue that it is the responsibility of the governments of poorer nations to look after their citizens themselves. This perspective suggests that wealthy nations should not be expected to solve the problems of other countries, and that each nation should be accountable for its own development. Moreover, providing aid without ensuring good governance and effective institutions can create dependency and undermine the incentives for local leaders to implement necessary reforms.However, a balanced approach can be taken, where wealthy nations provide targeted assistance while also supporting the development of local capacities and institutions. This can include investing in education, healthcare, and infrastructure, as well as promoting trade and economic cooperation. Ultimately, the responsibility for a nation's development lies with its government, but wealthy nations can play a crucial role in supporting and supplementing these efforts. By working together and sharing knowledge, expertise, and resources, we can create a more equitable and prosperous world for all. Wealthy nations can make a significant difference in the lives of millions of people, and it is our collective responsibility to ensure that everyone has access to the basic necessities of life.

question: Out of our country's health budget, a large proportion should be diverted from treatment to spend on health education and preventative measures.ÊTo what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: It is a completely right and extremely wise policy to focus on health education and preventative measures rather than treatment. Once applied, it will bring many benefits to both citizens and governments.Health education causes long-term positive effects on our next generations. First of all, thank to a full health education from their childhoods, children will have good habits of taking care of their own health and these habits may be kept in their adolescences. For example, if a child is educated to have a hygienic lifestyle at a very young age, he also keeps it when older. Secondly, health education will prepare for people especially children necessary knowledge to protect themselves from risks of diseases. Instead of afraid or panic, they may be calmer if unfortunately committing some normal diseases such as allergy or illness in seasonal changes. Many diseases which may be cured easily can turn to serious ones if we do not have right treatment. Health education will help people to have right choices of treatment to recover more quickly.Preventative measures will help improve general health state of all citizens. For example, vaccines will guarantee that pregnant women and their babies are protected from serious infectious diseases such as flu, smallpox, rubella so on. When huge injection campaigns are organized throughout our country, the community's health state will be improved remarkably. As human resources play a key role in the development of a country, investing money to enhance the general health state is a totally right decision. In addition, because the cost of treatment is often much higher than that of prevention, the government can save a lot of money for our country's health budget.In conclusion, I strongly agree that we should give more priority to health education and preventative measures than to treatment. However, reasonable attentions should be paid to treatment so that our citizens are always looked after with best services.
llm: The allocation of a country's health budget is a critical decision that can have far-reaching consequences for the well-being of its citizens. The statement suggests that a significant proportion of the health budget should be diverted from treatment to health education and preventative measures. I largely agree with this statement, as investing in health education and prevention can have long-term benefits for the health and wellbeing of a population.Treatment of illnesses and diseases is essential, but it is often a costly and reactive approach to healthcare. In contrast, health education and preventative measures can help to reduce the incidence of diseases and illnesses, thereby reducing the demand for treatment. By educating the public about healthy lifestyles, disease prevention, and early detection, individuals can take proactive steps to protect their health. This approach can lead to a significant reduction in healthcare costs and a decrease in the burden on the healthcare system.Furthermore, preventative measures such as vaccination programs, screening tests, and health checks can help to detect and prevent diseases at an early stage, reducing the need for costly treatments. For example, vaccination programs have been instrumental in controlling and eliminating infectious diseases such as smallpox and polio. By investing in health education and preventative measures, a country can promote a culture of health and wellbeing, leading to a healthier and more productive population.However, it is also important to note that treatment should not be completely neglected. A balance needs to be struck between investing in health education and preventative measures, and providing adequate treatment options for those who require them. Ultimately, a well-allocated health budget should prioritize both prevention and treatment to ensure that citizens have access to comprehensive and effective healthcare.

question: The popularity of news media often has significant influence on people' lives. Some people believe that to be a negative development. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays news media have become more and more popular. Many people consider that the drawbacks of this phenomenon outweigh its merits. However, it is possible that this idea is not completely true. It is widely seen that news media not only brings people entertainment, but also polishes up people' knowledge. Therefore, it seems not unreasonable to suggest that this is a positive development.First and foremost, today entertainment is easier for people to enjoy than ever before. The fact is that such news media as televisions, radios, or newspapers are bringing many news on entertainment sector from all over the world to everybody. People can sit in front of their televisions and watch whatever they want, from musical concerts to live football match. This is a convenient way of relaxation after hard work. Obviously, the popularity of news media is beneficial to human beings.In addition to this, news media help people broaden their knowledge. It is clearly seen that mass media provide people with a variety of global news on all fields, including political situation, economic change, global warming, and so forth. Hence, there is a strong likelihood that today people are able to know the world better. This is particularly essential when the globalization process has been permeating into all areas of society. Indeed, the fast growth of news media is helpful for people worldwide.In conclusion, the development of news media has been making great inroads into the lives of all people. It relaxes people with plentiful entertainment news. It enriches people's knowledge with worldwide information. It also positively affects the way people live in many other aspects. Therefore, the progress of news media is an advantageous development.
llm: The rise of news media has undoubtedly become a pervasive aspect of modern life, and its impact on individuals is a subject of considerable debate. While some argue that the popularity of news media has a detrimental effect on people's lives, I tend to disagree with this notion.On the one hand, it is true that excessive exposure to news media can lead to a phenomenon known as "compassion fatigue," where individuals become desensitized to the plight of others due to the constant bombardment of negative news. Furthermore, news outlets often prioritize sensationalism over factual reporting, which can create unnecessary anxiety and stress among viewers. However, these drawbacks can be mitigated by responsible media consumption and a critical approach to news analysis.On the other hand, the benefits of a well-informed and engaged citizenry far outweigh the potential drawbacks. News media plays a crucial role in holding those in power accountable, providing a platform for marginalized voices, and facilitating public discourse on pressing issues. By staying informed about current events, individuals can make more informed decisions, engage in meaningful conversations, and participate in the democratic process. Moreover, the diversity of perspectives and opinions presented in the news media can foster empathy, tolerance, and a deeper understanding of the complexities of the world.In conclusion, while it is essential to acknowledge the potential pitfalls of news media, I firmly believe that its popularity has a net positive impact on people's lives. By promoting media literacy, critical thinking, and responsible consumption, individuals can harness the power of news media to become more engaged, informed, and active members of society. Ultimately, a well-informed and discerning public is essential for the health of democracy and the betterment of society as a whole.

question: Under British and Australian laws, a jury in a criminal case has no access to information about the defendant's past criminal record. This protects the person who is being accused of the crime. Some lawyers have suggested that this practice should be changed and that a jury should be given all the past facts before they reach their decision about the case. Do you agree or disagree?Ê
human: It is a well known fact that a jury involved in a case has no information regarding the criminal's past illegal acts under the British and Australian laws. There are few of those who are concerned think the current practice should be altered and that the juries should at least know something about the criminals before coming to a conclusion. I, for one, agree to this resolution whole-heartedly as it poses advantages to various parties as I shall discuss below.First and foremost, I believe that it would be easier for the juries to make a decision if they know about the past information about the criminal. This is because, knowing their background very well will enable the juries to analyze the crime before coming up with a judgment. For instance, take a person who has not murdered anyone but is suddenly found to be guilty. The juries will be able to know weather the individual committed the crime intentionally or due to circumstances by knowing the facts about the person. Then, punishment can be given in accordance to the condition.Apart from that, a fair trial can be achieved. As all of us know, juries are a group of people who have no or less knowledge regarding law. Thus, exposing them to the past records of the criminal can give them more room to think rationally and finally put the pieces together in order to produce a more meaningful decision. By doing so, the juries will have a sense of relief that they have come up with better conclusion based on plenty of evidences. Not only that, the convicted will also receive a fair action.It is undeniable that when the background of the convicted is 'dug' deeper and is revealed to mass of anonymous people, his privacy is being jeopardized. If finally he is proven innocent, he may feel embarrassed to face the public. However, I am sure that the crimes done by criminals should be brought to light and the public should be aware of it so that they will not become a victim as well.To conclude, I definitely feel that the current way of the juries judging the case should be transformed and they should know the facts about the criminals they are dealing with. This is of paramount importance so that they will be able to give a better and reliable as well as a fair judgment to the convicted. Beneficial changes will certainly take place if changes are made because for a change to happen, changes have to be done.
llm: The practice of withholding a defendant's past criminal record from a jury in a criminal case is a long-standing principle in British and Australian laws. The primary purpose of this practice is to ensure that the defendant receives a fair trial, and that the jury's decision is based solely on the evidence presented in the current case. I strongly disagree with the suggestion that this practice should be changed and that a jury should be given access to a defendant's past criminal record.Allowing a jury to know about a defendant's past crimes could lead to prejudice and bias, potentially influencing their decision. The jury's role is to determine whether the defendant is guilty or not guilty based on the evidence presented, and not to punish them for past misdeeds. If a jury is aware of a defendant's past record, they may be more likely to assume guilt, even if the evidence in the current case is not conclusive. This could result in wrongful convictions and undermine the integrity of the justice system.Furthermore, a defendant's past record is not always relevant to the current case, and may not provide a complete picture of their character or behavior. By withholding this information, the jury is forced to focus on the facts of the current case, and make a decision based on the evidence presented. This ensures that justice is served, and that the defendant receives a fair trial. In conclusion, the current practice of withholding a defendant's past criminal record from a jury is an essential aspect of a fair trial, and should not be changed. It protects the rights of the accused and ensures that justice is served based on the evidence, rather than on past mistakes or misdeeds.

question: Popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Whenever an international sporting occasion like the football World Cup takes place, it attracts millions of people all over the world. As sport has become a common passion which passed over every national border, popular sports events can help reduce international tensions remarkably and promote national prides safely.First and foremost, sports events are good chances for excellent athletes to meet and learn valuable experiences from one another so that they can improve their results, break records and bring victories to their own countries. Because a large number of people will gather in the host city for sport events, there are many good opportunities for discovering different cultures. Consequently, sport events with the spirit of healthiness, honesty and fairness can help strengthen understanding, friendship and solidarity among nations. After sharing competitive but interesting moments in each competition, the competitors often shake hands friendly and congratulate the winners, which can lead to an improvement in the relationships among nations.Secondly, sporting occasions play an essential role in raising patriotic emotions in both athletes and spectators. Seeing national flags be honored may be the most emotional moments to each athlete. The athlete also seems to be more aware of his responsibilities and he wants to contribute more to his beloved country. When witnessing our national flags flying proudly among others, many of us can stop hiding our pride and happiness. For instance, when Vietnam became the champion of SEAGAMES for the first time in 2008, a festival atmosphere permeated into the streets. People from all ages turned out to the streets with flags, banners and they sang aloud songs of Ho Chi Minh President. The eager atmosphere lasted many next days. In fact, some hooligans were so excited that they took part in motor racing or using fireworks illegally. However, the hooligans only took a minority of people. Therefore, it can be said that sport events help to wake up love and responsibilities strongly in each citizen.In conclusion, international sporting occasions are not only one of the effective solutions to tensions among nations but also a stimulant for releasing patriotic emotions safely. Hence, I recommend that big sports events should be held more frequently in the future.
llm: The notion that popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions play a crucial role in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way is a topic of debate. While some argue that these events bring people together and foster global unity, I partially agree with this statement.On the one hand, these events do provide a platform for nations to come together,On the other hand, these events can also exacerbate existing tensions and create new ones. The intense rivalry and competitive nature of these events can lead to an increase in nationalist sentiments,In conclusion, popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions have both positive and negative effects on international tensions and patriotic emotions.

question: In many countries, children are engaged in some kind of paid work. Some people regard as completely wrong, while others consider it as some kind of work experience, important for learning and taking responsibilities.ÊWhat are your opinions on this?
human: In many countries, children are educated from their young age to be independent and responsible for their actions. Their parents allow them to take some jobs because these jobs can help them learn and take responsibilities. However, some people think it's not a good educational measure. From my point of view, the benefits of children engagement in paid work outweigh its drawbacks.First of all, children can learn about the hardship of earning money. When they take some kind of paid work such as looking after babies, doing housework and keeping shops, they will have some life experience and skills which make them mature and can deal with many different situations in real life. Therefore, they are likely to understand their parents' hardship, to respect values of money and to form a good habit of saving.Secondly, when children take jobs, they tend to be more responsible because whether they can earn money or not will depend on their effectiveness and attitudes in working. To keep their jobs, children will have to try their best to finish their duties. For example, if a child works as a shop assistant, he will have to keep an eye on good and products, calculate prices correctly and take responsibilities for any lost.Some people may argue that children will be more material, neglect their study for earning money or be exploited by the employers. However, if children get good care and instructions from their parents, they can take advantages of the work to learn valuable things and avoid going in a wrong way.In conclusion, if children take part in some kind of paid work with their parents' permission, they can learn lively lessons and become mature and responsible. I recommend that parents should help their children to choose a suitable job which does not affect their children 's study and that the government should have right policies to avoid exploiting children's labour.
llm: The issue of children engaging in paid work is a contentious one, with opinions divided on its merits. While some people vehemently oppose the idea, citing exploitation and harm to the child's well-being, others see it as a valuable learning experience that teaches responsibility and important life skills. In my opinion, the question of whether children should be engaged in paid work depends on the nature and context of the work.On the one hand, it is undeniable that some forms of paid work can be detrimental to a child's physical, emotional, and educational development. Children who are forced to work long hours in hazardous or exploitative conditions can suffer from physical harm, psychological trauma, and missed educational opportunities. This is clearly unacceptable and should be strongly condemned.On the other hand, not all paid work is created equal. Some forms of work, such as part-time jobs or internships, can provide children with valuable skills, experience, and a sense of responsibility. These opportunities can help children develop important life skills, such as time management, teamwork, and financial literacy, while also supplementing their education with practical, real-world experience.Ultimately, the key to resolving this debate lies in striking a balance between protecting children's rights and providing them with valuable learning experiences. Governments, employers, and parents must work together to ensure that any paid work undertaken by children is safe, regulated, and complementary to their education. By doing so, we can help children develop into capable, responsible, and productive members of society, while also protecting them from exploitation and harm.

question: In some countries young people are encouraged to work or travel for a year between finishing high school and starting university studies. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages for young people who decide to do this.
human: Nowadays, it is an increasingly common trend to take a break before starting university studies. It is not just becoming common among rich students but also in the poor students. Students take a break of year or two, some students travel all around the world during this time, and some choose to take up a job.Experience gained through traveling to different places, meeting different people and even at job goes long way. It not only enhances the confidence of a student but also makes them independent. Student's who works tend to gather better financial resources which they can rely on during their university studies. This experience also makes them aware of what they would like to make of their life. They develop broader view and can make a better choice of their future studies or courses.Taking a break not just has benefits but it also comes with some negative impacts. Once student's starts earning, they might not like to go back to studies where they would lose their financial independence. They might even find it difficult to adapt to education environment. There is also a risk of student never going back to university or higher education. Probably some might take some short term courses instead of proper and complete university education, which will help them to get a better job and salaries. This might only help them in a short run as it is a known fact that to make a reasonable career in longer runs, one needs a proper and higher qualification.In my view point, I would agree to idea of taking a break before starting higher education. Students who take break, gain lot of benefits by traveling around the places or by working. They tend to contribute more due to their real world experiences which makes them more mature.
llm: The trend of taking a gap year between completing high school and commencing university studies has gained popularity worldwide. This break allows young individuals to work, travel, or engage in other activities that foster personal growth and development. While there are advantages to taking a gap year, there are also some disadvantages that need to be considered.On the positive side, taking a gap year can provide young people with invaluable life experiences and skills. By working, they can gain practical knowledge, develop a sense of responsibility, and earn money to support their future university expenses. Travelling, on the other hand, broadens their cultural understanding, exposes them to diverse ways of life, and enhances their independence. Additionally, a gap year can give students time to reflect on their academic and career goals, potentially leading to a more focused and motivated approach to their university studies.However, there are also potential downsides to taking a gap year. One of the main concerns is that it may disrupt the momentum of academic learning, leading to a decrease in study habits and retention of knowledge gained in high school. Furthermore, delaying university entrance might put students at a disadvantage compared to their peers who enroll immediately, especially in competitive fields where an early start can be beneficial. Moreover, not all gap year activities are productive or safe, and some young people might find themselves in unsuitable or even risky situations.In conclusion, while taking a gap year can offer numerous benefits such as personal growth, practical experience, and financial support, it also comes with potential drawbacks including academic disruption and competitive disadvantage. Ultimately, the decision to take a gap year should be based on individual circumstances and goals, ensuring that the experience is utilized to enhance future academic and professional success.

question: The qualities a person needs to become successful in today's world cannot be learned at a university or similar academic institution. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: In today's modern and competitive society, it is undeniable that we must equip ourselves with plenty of knowledge and skills in order to shine and to be successful in life. Many opine that the aforementioned aspects are mostly obtained through learning in academic institutions. I do agree to that opinion to a certain degree. Nevertheless, I feel that one can also shine without even having to attend universities.First and foremost, it is certainly true that university education is of paramount importance for certain professions such as doctor, engineer and lawyer. Without proper training and knowledge, it would be impossible for them to perform their best in their careers. Not only that, when they are in a university, they will have the opportunity to share their knowledge as well as to network for business associates and partners.
